data.title: Candy
data.statement: You need to find and print the total sweetness of a package of candy and if it is sweet enough for the requirement, at least 10 more, or not sweet enough. If it has anything other than a listed candy print "{{Invalid Input.}}". A {{Gumball}} = 4, {{Chocolate}} = 7, {{Jellybeans}} = 10, and {{Cotton_Candy}} = 11.

data.stubGenerator:
read r:int
read n:int
loop n read l:word(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer representing how much the sweetness total should be[[r]]
<<Line 2:>> A positive number [[n]] 
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> The type of candy
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>>
   "{{Too Sweet!}}" if the total sweetness is more than 5 sweeter than [[r]];
   "{{Just Right.}}" if the total sweetness in a range of 5 of [[r]];
    "{{Blegh!}}" if [[r]] is 6 or more than the total sweetness.
    "{{Invalid Input.}}" if a candy is not one of the 4 listed above.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to find and print the total sweetness of a package of candy and if it is sweet enough for the requirement, at least 10 more, or not sweet enough. If it has anything other than a listed candy print "Invalid Input.". A Gumball = 4, Chocolate = 7, Jellybeans = 10, and Cotton_Candy = 11.
Input
Line 1: An integer representing how much the sweetness total should ber
Line 2: A positive number n
Next n lines: The type of candy
Output
Line 1:
"Too Sweet!" if the total sweetness is more than 5 sweeter than r;
"Just Right." if the total sweetness in a range of 5 of r;
"Blegh!" if r is 6 or more than the total sweetness.
"Invalid Input." if a candy is not one of the 4 listed above.
Constraints
0<r<100
0<n<100
Example
Input
69
8
Jellybeans
Cotton_Candy
Jellybeans
Chocolate
Gumball
Cotton_Candy
Chocolate
Gumball
Output
Just Right.
